mdRecord.dcterms:title: Indenture, Henry Trenn to Lawrence Washington, witnessed by George Washington, probably 1750 March 1
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Trenn, Henry
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Henry Trenn binds himself to pay Â£50 unless he "make or cause to be made unto the above sd. Lawrence Washington ... a Lease for the Term of nine hundred ninety & nine Years of all the Land which is at this present overflowed by the sd. Washington Mill Dam included within the sd. Trenn Bounds on Dogue Runn ..." Signed by Henry Trenn (his mark); witnessed by G. Washington, Sarah Carlyle and Anne Cary. Endorsed on reverse, "Henry Trenn's Bond for Performance of Covenant". Document signed, silked, red seal blurred.
